bartMachine

Class bartMachineRegressionMultThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • bartMachine.Classifier
      • bartMachine.bartMachineRegressionMultThread
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    bartMachineClassificationMultThread

    public class bartMachineRegressionMultThread
extends Classifier
    This class handles the parallelization of many Gibbs chains over many CPU cores to create one BART regression model. It also handles all operations on the completed model.
    Author:
    Adam Kapelner and Justin Bleich

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class bartMachine.Classifier

        Classifier.ErrorTypes

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.Double alpha
      A hyperparameter that controls how easy it is to grow new nodes in a tree independent of depth
      protected bartMachineRegression[] bart_gibbs_chain_threads
      the collection of num_cores BART models which will run separate Gibbs chains
      protected java.lang.Double beta
      A hyperparameter that controls how easy it is to grow new nodes in a tree dependent on depth which makes it more difficult as the tree gets deeper
      protected double[] cov_split_prior
      The probability vector that samples covariates for selecting split rules
      protected boolean destroyed
      "Destroyed" means this model's Gibbs samplers' data has been released to RAM and hence cannot be operated on
      protected bartMachineTreeNode[][] gibbs_samples_of_bart_trees_after_burn_in
      this is the combined gibbs samples after burn in from all of the num_cores chains
      protected java.lang.Double hyper_k
      this controls where to set hyper_sigsq_mu by forcing the variance to be this number of standard deviations on the normal CDF
      protected java.lang.Double hyper_nu
      half the shape parameter and half the multiplicand of the scale parameter of the inverse gamma prior on the variance
      protected java.lang.Double hyper_q
      At a fixed hyper_nu, this controls where to set hyper_lambda by forcing q proportion to be at that value in the inverse gamma CDF
      protected boolean mem_cache_for_speed
      whether or not we use the memory cache feature
      protected int num_cores
      the number of CPU cores to build many different Gibbs chain within a BART model
      protected int num_gibbs_burn_in
      the number of burn-in samples in each Gibbs chain
      protected int num_gibbs_total_iterations
      the total number of gibbs samples where each chain gets a number of burn-in and then the difference from the total divided by num_cores
      protected int num_trees
      the number of trees in this BART model on all Gibbs chains
      protected java.lang.Double prob_grow
      the hyperparameter of the probability of picking a grow step during the Metropolis-Hastings tree proposal
      protected java.lang.Double prob_prune
      the hyperparameter of the probability of picking a prune step during the Metropolis-Hastings tree proposal
      private java.lang.Double sample_var_y
      the estimate of some upper limit of the variance of the response which is usually the MSE from a a linear regression
      protected int total_iterations_multithreaded
      the total number of Gibbs samples for each of the num_cores chains
      protected boolean verbose
      should we print select messages to the screen

        MISSING_VALUE, n, ON_WINDOWS, p, unique_name, X_y, X_y_by_col, y_orig, y_trans

      bartMachineRegressionMultThread()
      the default constructor sets the number of total iterations each Gibbs chain is charged with sampling

      • setNumGibbsTotalIterations

        public void setNumGibbsTotalIterations(int num_gibbs_total_iterations)
        This is a simple setter for the number of total Gibbs samples and it also sets the total iterations per Gibbs chain running on each CPU core (see formula in the code)
        Parameters:
        num_gibbs_total_iterations - The number of total Gibbs iterations to set

        public int numSamplesAfterBurning()
        The number of samples after burning is simply the title minus the burn-in

                                      int num_cores_evaluate)
        Return the predictions from each tree for each burned-in Gibbs sample
        Parameters:
        records - the observations / records for which to return predictions
        num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation
        Returns:
        Predictions for all records further indexed by Gibbs sample

      • getPostPredictiveIntervalForPrediction

        protected double[] getPostPredictiveIntervalForPrediction(double[] record,
                                              double coverage,
                                              int num_cores_evaluate)
        Using the getGibbsSamplesForPrediction(double[][], int) function, return a credible interval at a specified level of coverage
        Parameters:
        record - The record for which to obtain an interval
        coverage - The desired coverage
        num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation
        Returns:
        A double pair which represents the upper and lower bound of coverage

        Returns:

      • getAcceptRejectMHsAfterBurnIn

        public boolean[][] getAcceptRejectMHsAfterBurnIn(int thread_num)
        Returns a record of Metropolis-Hastings acceptances or rejections for all trees after burn-in
        Parameters:
        thread_num - Which CPU core's acceptance / rejection record should be returned
        Returns:
        Yes/No's for acceptances for all Gibbs samples further indexed by tree

      • getCountsForAllAttribute

        public int[][] getCountsForAllAttribute(java.lang.String type)
        Return the number of times each of the attributes were used during the construction of the sum-of-trees by Gibbs sample.
        Parameters:
        type - Either "splits" or "trees" ("splits" means total number and "trees" means sum of binary values of whether or not it has appeared in the tree)
        Returns:
        The counts for all Gibbs samples further indexed by the attribute 1, ..., p

      • getAttributeProps

        public double[] getAttributeProps(java.lang.String type)
        Return the proportion of times each of the attributes were used (count over total number of splits) during the construction of the sum-of-trees by Gibbs sample.
        Parameters:
        type - Either "splits" or "trees" ("splits" means total number and "trees" means sum of binary values of whether or not it has appeared in the tree)
        Returns:
        The proportion of splits for all Gibbs samples further indexed by the attribute 1, ..., p

      • getInteractionCounts

        public int[][] getInteractionCounts()
        For all Gibbs samples after burn in, calculate the set of interaction counts (consider a split on x_j and a daughter node splits on x_k and that would be considered an "interaction")
        Returns:
        A matrix of size p x p where the row is top split and the column is a bottom split. It is recommended to triangularize the matrix after ignoring the order.

      • FlushData

        protected void FlushData()
        Flush all unnecessary data from the Gibbs chains to conserve RAM
        Specified by:
        FlushData in class Classifier

      • Evaluate

        public double Evaluate(double[] record)
        The default BART evaluation of a new observations is done via sample average of the posterior predictions. Other functions can be used here such as median, mode, etc. Default is to use one CPU core.
        Overrides:
        Evaluate in class Classifier
        Parameters:
        record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
        Returns:
        The prediction

      • Evaluate

        public double Evaluate(double[] record,
              int num_cores_evaluate)
        The default BART evaluation of a new observations is done via sample average of the posterior predictions. Other functions can be used here such as median, mode, etc.
        Specified by:
        Evaluate in class Classifier
        Parameters:
        record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
        num_cores_evaluate - The number of CPU cores to use during evaluation
        Returns:
        The prediction

      • getDepthsForTreesInGibbsSampAfterBurnIn

        public int[][] getDepthsForTreesInGibbsSampAfterBurnIn(int thread_num)
        After burn in, find the depth (greatest generation of a terminal node) of each tree for each Gibbs sample
        Parameters:
        thread_num - which CPU core (which Gibbs chain) to return results for
        Returns:
        for each Gibbs chain return a vector of depths for all num_trees chains

      • getNumNodesAndLeavesForTreesInGibbsSampAfterBurnIn

        public int[][] getNumNodesAndLeavesForTreesInGibbsSampAfterBurnIn(int thread_num)
        After burn in, return the number of total nodes (internal plus terminal) of each tree for each Gibbs sample
        Parameters:
        thread_num - which CPU core (which Gibbs chain) to return results for
        Returns:
        for each Gibbs chain return a vector of number of nodes for all num_trees chains
